image.altText: flowers and a card laid on a fence

props.synopsis: A disability advocate says the death of a woman with "significant" disabilities and who was living in "squalid conditions" is a reminder that change is needed to ensure people do not "slip through the cracks".

title.children: 'How is this still happening?': Death of woman with disabilities prompts calls for safeguards

image.altText: A woman in a red top addresses the media.

props.synopsis: Anti-abortion activist Joanna Howe has been barred from parts of South Australia's parliament, with the upper house's president telling the chamber she allegedly insulted, intimidated and threatened MPs on the night of a vote about late-term abortion law.

title.children: Anti-abortion campaigner banned from parts of SA parliament over alleged 'threatening' tactics

image.altText: man speaking to reporters

props.synopsis: A South Australian MP found guilty of multiple counts of deception has won a bid to postpone his sentencing — and retain his position in parliament — until the outcome of a Supreme Court appeal.

title.children: MP found guilty of deception labels SA case a 'sideshow' as sentence postponed

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: The hit-run crash death of the youngest son of South Australia's top cop gripped South Australians, who grieved the 18-year-old "widely and deeply".

title.children: Charlie Stevens's untimely crash death caused collective grief

image.altText: Windmill to the left. Lightning to the right of the image taken in the outback.

props.synopsis: After weeks of power instability in Far West NSW, the federal government has announced up to 13 weeks of income support. Transgrid has also issued a formal apology and committed an additional $500,000 in grants.

title.children: Worker income support on offer as Transgrid apologises for rolling blackouts in outback NSW

image.altText: Para surfer Chris Blowes and his board.

props.synopsis: Australia's best para surfers are heading to the United States for the world titles. For Chris Blowes, it represents a full circle moment.

title.children: Para surfing was key to Chris's recovery after a shark attack so he's fighting for it to be a Paralympic event

image.altText: A blue and brown sign reading "Mount Gambier Courthouse" with a brick building in the back

props.synopsis: A man charged over the deaths of two children in a three-car crash involving an emu has been granted bail despite concerns from police that his mobile phone was taken from the scene and has not been found since.

title.children: Man accused of killing two children in crash granted bail despite police concerns about missing phone

image.altText: Hands holding a stuffed toy rabbit.

props.synopsis: An independent review triggered by "toxic culture" claims has concluded that the way in which SA's Department for Child Protection handles complaints against staff is "generally sound", but that there is room for improvement.

title.children: SA's child protection complaints process 'generally sound', independent review finds

image.altText: A man with a neutral expression looks on.

props.synopsis: When a German researcher arrived in Yuendumu in 1972, the Indigenous community gave him rare access to their customs and culture. Half a century later, an emotional reunion has seen some sacred artefacts he was given returned.

title.children: These sacred artefacts were thought lost forever, but one phone call changed everything

image.altText: Dylan Clancy poses with a ukelele during her time in a prison music program

props.synopsis: A music program run by singer-songwriter Nancy Bates has helped female inmates survive the daily challenges of prison. Now, a documentary is putting the initiative under the spotlight.

title.children: New doco reveals how music behind bars prepares female prisoners for life after release

image.altText: A woman wears a cap and smile

props.synopsis: Sharmain's son is her motivation to get clean but a lack of rehab facilities means she almost spiralled into a state of psychosis after being forced to wait months to enter a program.

title.children: This young mother is fighting to get her son back but finding a place in rehab was a major battle

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing pink hi-vis vest waves walking off plane next to Gina Rinehart

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says his office did ask billionaire mining magnate Gina Rinehart "whether the plane might be available" to attend a memorial service, after the government did not provide a RAAF flight for him.

title.children: Peter Dutton says his office asked whether billionaire Gina Rinehart's jet was available for event

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Ms Lovell was fatally stabbed on her front lawn after confronting two 17-year-old boys who had broken into her North Lakes house, north of Brisbane, on Boxing Day in 2022.

title.children: Second teenager charged over home-invasion murder of Emma Lovell acquitted by judge

image.altText: A mobile crane arm stretches toward an apartment building, with a section collapsed.

props.synopsis: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the attack underscores the country's need for more military aid from its Western allies.

title.children: Guided bomb kills child in Kharkiv as Russia continues border push, Ukrainian officials say

image.altText: vehicles are trapped in the street during flooding

props.synopsis: Spain's national weather service says it has rained more in eight hours in Valencia than in the preceding 20 months, calling the deluge "extraordinary".

title.children: In photos: Deadly flash flooding in Spain kills at least 95 people

image.altText: A man struggles with his umbrella

props.synopsis: Administration forecaster Gene Huang urged people across the island to stay at home due to the danger of high winds.

title.children: One person dead as Typhoon Kong-rey strikes Taiwan's east coast

image.altText: Northcliffe dairy farmer Wally Bettink standing in a cracking dry dam

props.synopsis: Australia has warmed by 1.51 degrees as greenhouse gas emissions continue to rise. The BOM and CSIRO State of the Climate report shows it has fuelled extreme heat events over land and oceans, longer fire seasons and more intense heavy rainfall.

title.children: A BOM scientist used an off-beat metaphor as he unveiled a 'sobering' report looking at our future weather

image.altText: Gina Rinehart speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Australia's wealthiest woman throws embattled WA mining mogul Chris Ellison a billion-dollar lifeline, just days before he learns the outcome of an investigation into alleged tax evasion.

title.children: Rinehart throws embattled MinRes $1 billion lifeline amid investigation of alleged tax evasion

image.altText: the entrance to a kmart store

props.synopsis: Wesfarmers, owner of Kmart, Bunnings Warehouse, Officeworks and Priceline, announced a record $2.6 billion return.

title.children: Profit is not a 'dirty word', Wesfarmers chair says amid record profits

image.altText: Two men in suits smiling, while holding glasses of wine and looking at each other

props.synopsis: North Korean soldiers are not only on Russian soil, but have been deployed in Russia's Kursk region on the Ukrainian border. What exactly does this mean?

title.children: What we know about North Korean troops in Ukraine

image.altText: Optus

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission is suing Optus alleging it engaged in unconscionable conduct when selling phone products to vulnerable customers.

title.children: Optus accused of selling vulnerable customers products they 'did not want and could not afford'

image.altText: Matt Peacock in a suit and tie shaking hands with another man in a suit and tie, holding an award.

props.synopsis: Matt Peacock worked for a wide range of programs, as well as the broadcaster's foreign correspondent in London, Washington and New York.

title.children: Matt Peacock, former ABC journalist renowned for investigating asbestos issues, has died aged 72

image.altText: man silhouette standing infront of a white tent

props.synopsis: Europe's human rights watchdog has urged Cyprus to allow nearly three dozen asylum seekers out of a United Nations-controlled buffer zone, where they have been living in tents for months.

title.children: These asylum seekers are stranded in a 'buffer zone' in Cyprus. This is what we know

image.altText: Joshua Creamer

props.synopsis: Chair Joshua Creamer says he has had "no communication from the new government" following Saturday's election, but would welcome the chance to discuss the inquiry's work.

title.children: Queensland's Truth-Telling and Healing Inquiry to pause its workplan as newly elected government stands by commitment to end process

image.altText: Georgia Garnett of the Giants completes a hand pass as a defender begins to tackle her

props.synopsis: Georgia Garnett struggled at university while her mates managed to remain focused while studying. Her ADHD not only helped her understand her brain, but allowed her to excel in the AFLW.

title.children: How AFLW star Georgia Garnett learnt her ADHD was a weapon on the field

image.altText: The outside of a court building. A sign says "Supreme Court".

props.synopsis: An investigation into the government care provided to a 12-year-old girl who was charged with murder over a brutal stabbing last year has found failings in every aspect of her protection.

title.children: Case of 12-year-old charged with woman's murder revealed 'tragic' child protection failures, report finds

image.altText: A truck carries a large missile

props.synopsis: North Korea fires a long-range ballistic missile, marking Pyongyang's first weapons test since South Korea accused the country of sending tens of thousands of soldiers to Russia.

title.children: 'Designed to strike US': North Korea launches suspected long-range missile

image.altText: An older man sits in a house, looking unimpressed as he holds up his phone.

props.synopsis: A Far North Queensland council is investigating after its emergency warning system incorrectly alerted thousands of residents to fictional flooding and earthquake events early on Thursday.

title.children: False alarm as thousands of Queenslanders receive texts warning of non-existent natural disasters

image.altText: Protesters waving a flag.

props.synopsis: After months of delays, Pacific leaders this week completed a tour of riot stricken French Pacific territory New Caledonia, suggesting a Pacific police force could help lower the temperature.

title.children: Australian-backed Pacific police force an option to quell 'tension' in New Caledonia, Pacific leaders say

image.altText: A 3D model showing three Iron Dome components. A radar, a missile launcer and a command centre.

props.synopsis: Since its deployment in 2011, the Iron Dome has become a signature weapon in Israel’s armoury. A barrage of modern weaponry from Iran and its proxies is testing its limits.

title.children: A look inside the sophisticated attacks breaking through Israel's anti-missile systems

image.altText: Two white women in hats and sunglasses standing smiling on a dirt path

props.synopsis: Patients have told ABC NEWS they're concerned about a lack of informed consent over Australia's most common osteoporosis drug, and are sometimes "scared into" taking it.

title.children: It's a common osteoporosis drug — but some patients say they're not being warned enough about side effects

image.altText: A closeup shot of a hemp leaf in the sunlight.

props.synopsis: Having never built a house before, Dan decided his first would be his dream home — a sustainable, off-grid hemp house in Tasmania, rendered with a horse poo mix and with an outdoor composting toilet.

title.children: 'It seemed too good to be true': Why this couple built their house out of hemp

image.altText: Two people hugging.

props.synopsis: In publishing his reasons to grant Peter Damjanovic a judge-alone trial for the alleged murderer of Tiffany Woodley, Justice Joseph McGrath reveals graphic details of the state's case against him. WARNING: Indigenous readers are advised this story contains photos of someone who has died.

title.children: Judge-alone trial granted in 'horrific' DV case in which woman allegedly beaten to death in Bedford home

image.altText: Marcus Harris and Cameron Bancroft running between wickets while out batting

props.synopsis: Test hopefuls Sam Konstas and Cameron Bancroft have been dismissed for ducks batting for Australia A, while Marcus Harris also fell cheaply in a major blow for their international ambitions.

title.children: Konstas, Bancroft, Harris fail for Australia A with a Test opening spot up for grabs
